intro: Rosa rhodopaea, commonly known as the Greek pink rose, is a shrub-like perennial native to the mountainous regions of Greece and Turkey. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to white. The plant has narrow, dark green leaves with serrated edges and is well adapted to rocky, well-drained soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, adding delicate beauty to its natural habitat. Rosa rhodopaea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in temperate climates.
